benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails - Add account email

covered: Valid Payload: TC01 (successful creation) and TC02/TC03/TC04/TC05 cover successful additions under various header/body conditions.

Error Handling & Validation: TC07 (invalid accountId format), TC08 (missing accountId), TC10 (malformed JSON), TC11 (missing required fields), TC12 (invalid email format), TC13 (missing required header), TC14 (unauthorized access), TC15 (service unavailability), TC17 (empty request body), TC18 (unexpected query params behavior), TC23 (SQL injection in email field), TC24 (XSS attempt), TC21 (unicode input) and TC22 (backward compatibility).

Security & Validation Scenarios: TC13-TC15 cover header presence, auth, and authorization; TC23-TC24 cover injection/malicious input; TC20 covers concurrency; TC25 covers transient/network recovery; TC26 covers integration/consistency; TC27 covers documentation/error clarity.
Recovery & Resilience: TC25 (transient network failure) and TC26 (integration propagation) and TC20 (concurrent requests) address resilience and consistency.
Regression Scenarios: TC21 (unicode) and TC22 (backwards compatibility) address backward-compatibility and regression concerns.
Accessibility/Documentation: TC27 focuses on documentation and error message accessibility.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination handling for large result sets (GET-like lists are not applicable to POST here, but there is no explicit test ensuring behavior with large-scale data retrieval after creation).
Authorization Granularity: While TC14/TC13 cover unauthorized/header cases, explicit tests differentiating 401 vs 403 in all edge cases are not exhaustively enumerated.
Rate Limiting: No tests address rate limiting or throttling of concurrent requests.
Caching/ETag: No tests verify caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) for the created resource or listing endpoints.
Internal Server Error (500) Simulation: No explicit test simulates a 500 Internal Server Error from database or service layer (only 503, 400, 404, 401/403 are exercised).
Duplicate Submission: No explicit test ensuring idempotency or handling of duplicate email creation for the same account.
Large Payload Boundary: While TC16 mentions large payloads, detailed boundary sizes and strict validation of payload limits could be more explicit.
Specific error payloads: Some tests describe general error presence; more precise assertions on error body structure/content across different 4xx/5xx scenarios would improve coverage.
recommendations: Add explicit tests for rate limiting on POST /emails to ensure proper throttling and behavior under load.
Introduce tests for 500 Internal Server Error scenarios to validate server-side failure handling, including proper error responses and telemetry.
Add a dedicated test for idempotency/duplicate submission handling to ensure duplicates are either rejected or gracefully deduplicated.
Enhance edge-case tests around authorization with distinct 401 vs 403 outcomes across more scenarios (e.g., missing token vs insufficient scope).
Include tests for caching headers on the created resource and for listing responses where applicable (to cover caching behavior).
Create explicit boundary-testing for maximum payload sizes with concrete numeric limits, and verify system behavior under exactly at the boundary and just beyond.
